metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10735 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Bootstrap 3.x before 3.4.0 and 4.x-beta before 4.0.0-beta.2, XSS is possible in the data-target attribute, a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-14041.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fonts-glyphicons-halflings - 3.4.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

libjs-bootstrap - 3.4.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

libjs-bootstrap4 - 4.0.0
No subscription required

criterions.comment: twitter-bootstrap3 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.0+dfsg-1').
twitter-bootstrap3 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.0+dfsg-1').
twitter-bootstrap4 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.0').
